ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and gives little, and that grudgingly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Who gives but little, and is niggardly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: who gave a little, and then stopped?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and grudgingly spends very little for the cause of God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And he gave a little, then refrained?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And gave a little, then stopped
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And gives a little and (then) withholds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and gives a little, and then grudgingly?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And gave a little, then was grudging?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: who at first gave a little, then later held back?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And gave little, and then stopped?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: gave a little and held off?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Gives a little, then hardens (his heart)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And gave a little, then stopped (giving)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And gave a little, and held back?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And gave a little and [then] refrained?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:34] and gave a little, of the stated sum of money, and was then grudging?, refrained from [giving] the remainder (akdā derives from al-kudya, earth that is hard as rock and which prevents the well-digger from digging through when he hits it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And gave a little) for the sake of Allah, (then was grudging) then stopped his spending and almsgiving in the way of Allah?
